title: Government records £9.4bn surplus in January
text:
Government records £9.4bn surplus in January 21 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright Getty Images Government finances recorded a £9.4bn in surplus in January, £0.3bn higher than the same month last year. 
Boosted by self-assessment tax receipts, January is typically a strong month for government finances. 
For the financial year-to-date, public sector net borrowing stands at £49.3bn, down £13.6bn from the same period in the previous year. 
The year-to-date borrowing figure is the lowest since the comparable period in 2008. Related Topics
